document.title: Maryland College and Career Ready Standards for English Language Arts Grades 1-2

93EFB91FB52E474290F835F2289039B4.description:
Use words and phrases acquired through conversations,
reading and being read to, and responding to texts, including
using frequently occurring conjunctions to signal simple
relationships (e.g., because).

F7F6DC369A10491E921647A62EFE53CF.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs differing in
manner (e.g., look, peek, glance, stare, glare, scowl) and adjectives
differing in intensity (e.g., large, gigantic) by defining or choosing
them or by acting out the meanings.

0A0BEEAB9E4B4D3682A14272245D48D7.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their use
(e.g., note places at home that are cozy).

EAA5CD3FFF124709B31E179DC842BA24.description:
Define words by category and by one or more key attributes
(e.g., a duck is a bird that swims; a tiger is a large cat with stripes).

0B906DF9FBEE493A993F071CFF58E320.description:
Sort words into categories (e.g., colors, clothing) to gain a
sense of the concepts the categories represent.

73D35294CDAB4FF6877531716038BBCE.description:
With guidance and support from adults, demonstrate
understanding of word relationships and nuances in word
meanings.

3D86E83418D54DB6AB543EB75830EE3D.description:
Identify frequently occurring root words (e.g., look) and their
inflectional forms (e.g. looks, looked, looking).

2F46BE535C434312AEC2E11997B8B044.description:
Use frequently occurring affixes as a clue to the meaning of a
word.

FD6A45821E474A02B7ACFEDF5C70AC72.description:
Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a
word or phrase.

C2E29811B2844D18B3182E1281F3C9CB.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 1 reading and content,
choosing flexibly from an array of strategies.

6304B4FD32444278B8F71CBFB472809C.description:
Spell untaught words phonetically, drawing on phonemic
awareness and spelling conventions.

BE5501A6A00A4F74936401D3941926D9.description:
Use conventional spelling for words with common spelling
patterns and for frequently occurring irregular words.

85F3F292DDEA4505AC549CDFC5E062D5.description: Use commas in dates and to separate single words in a series.

C88ADDE4124845A1AC25686716B7FE51.description: Capitalize dates and names of people.

2ACBC5E8F1B64A4BB8F6B07EDAF1F7D2.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard
English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

BA2DBB5D18084F44BE3203161014CEBA.description:
Produce and expand complete simple and compound
declarative, interrogative, imperative, and exclamatory sentences
in response to prompts.

D294D5441C7A44A8AE7C877B5097B0E8.description:
Use frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., during, beyond,
toward).

CD6F777D76DC430FB00B10CFECF5960E.description:
Use frequently occurring conjunctions (e.g., and, but, or, so,
because).

0DD092032DA8441AA86D1A15A39DF1F6.description:
Use verbs to convey a sense of past, present, and future
(e.g., Yesterday I walked home; Today I walk home; Tomorrow I will
walk home).

B9E662A7411E45238B13F8962AD6D886.description:
Use personal, possessive, and indefinite pronouns (e.g., I,
me, my; they, them, their, anyone, everything).

A804E1E0F24544B1A70EE31FE8AE3C76.description:
Use singular and plural nouns with matching verbs in basic
sentences (e.g., He hops; We hop).

5D5BFCEDD5AE4D4EB497870F0F49D28E.description: Use common, proper, and possessive nouns.

140D5D3F216246FAB065DCBDC5C690F9.description: Print all upper- and lowercase letters.

BF705AF90E7844B6A1826C21B80B5B0C.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of
standard English grammar and usage when writing or
speaking.

AB61C454906A46568156553FF8E1775F.description:
Produce complete sentences when appropriate to task and
situation. (See grade 1 Language standards 1 and 3 for specific
expectations.)

9F40055EE40B47C8B68A9F9A5CC1D407.description:
Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions when
appropriate to clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings.

CD786817830545DCBDA021A4DC893096.description:
Describe people, places, things, and events with
relevant details, expressing ideas and feelings clearly.

64374FD6FFBF4B0295068A2A491DB221.description:
Ask and answer questions about what a speaker says in order to
gather additional information, or clarify something that is not
understood.

F3CAFEEE6AB5482F861C14768A8CBEDE.description:
Ask and answer questions about key details in a text read aloud or
information presented orally or through other media.

1BD2DBF88FED4C7EABC73234F3DE7198.description:
Ask questions to clear up any confusion about the topics
and texts under discussion.

CAB6B095BE37495E8F7649ED2B04C656.description:
Build on others' talk in conversations by responding to the
comments of others through multiple exchanges.

65D35761497A4CD8BABBB2562C9A6A0B.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussion (e.g., listening to
others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts
under discussion).

5418BCE80A454D788685266C399392DB.description:
Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners
about grade 1 topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger
groups.

3D4E37B10CBA4D0697419B2CFCE810FA.description:
With guidance and support from adults, recall information from
experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a
question.

D76AD4FB71F74F1185948C7A6254EF76.description:
Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a
number of "how-to" books on a given topic and use them to write a
sequence of instructions).

4D82C291C51B429A99FA528DD9C32BC6.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

707015EB1B76401F9F79A3C1A79045BD.description: With guidance and support from adults, use a variety of

C7D8360FC3B1469FAFE875331CA9C824.description:
With guidance and support from adults, focus on a topic, respond
to questions and suggestions from peers, and add details to strengthen
writing as needed.

5AB3B6DCA67C4F39AE1F9B307A5FE000.description:
Write narratives in which they recount two or more appropriately
sequenced events, include some details regarding what happened, use
temporal words to signal event order, and provide some sense of
closure.

72A0F298727B494F9D23D92063196EB5.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts in which they name a topic,
supply some facts about the topic, and provide some sense of closure.

B3B761FC610E44CC97F738428185601E.description:
Write opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic or name
the book they are writing about, state an opinion, supply a reason for
the opinion, and provide some sense of closure.

26B254ACBA93425FA44FAC36510DDC4F.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition
and understanding, rereading as necessary

4AFA1F9BB6C4429FAD2E86440700A75E.description:
Read grade-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate
rate, and expression on successive readings.

D801E6E3149B4B6EB5BDEF141FB1A1D5.description: Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.

9BE8C6340B52428ABEAC5D61D2DF5502.description:
Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support
comprehension.

6BB97090A5324056B74274374ECC609C.description:
Recognize and read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled
words.

FF2F510FB3DC4519AF58B144EDAD53F3.description:
Decode two-syllable words following basic patterns by
breaking the words into syllables.

2461F9C587274E35AAF215B270DAC21D.description:
Use knowledge that every syllable must have a vowel
sound to determine the number of syllables in a printed word.

4663D95D26D04360AFE5C4C8CE5F6ACD.description:
Know final -e and common vowel team conventions for
representing long vowel sounds.

2342CC0FC2604B059F645CB98A12D660.description:
Know the spelling-sound correspondences for common
consonant digraphs.

1B16E13C285D4932980DFD851E22142C.description:
Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in
decoding words.

E8FD217B495D4A97BC3959E2607B4872.description:
Segment spoken single-syllable words into their complete
sequence of individual sounds (phonemes).

2877F018F5764038A124A757723284ED.description:
Isolate and pronounce initial, medial vowel, and final
sounds (phonemes), in spoken single-syllable words.

04B9E55F01AF451795008E1C9A69BAED.description:
Orally produce single-syllable words by blending sounds
(phonemes), including consonant blends.

16D69BE830AF41669AAECBA625F47865.description: Distinguish long from short vowel sounds in spoken single-syllable words.

A4445650C25843BC972E243C90996560.description:
Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and
sounds (phonemes).

CED98FFF76CB49C1B962A07240E5A793.description:
Recognize the distinguishing features of a sentence (e.g.,
first word, capitalization, ending punctuation).

9CF6E1E3C5E74A52A39E9654DDD1B6B3.description:
Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic
features of print.

837A24F91C10496DBB9D5C977F5DEFB5.description:
With prompting and support, read informational texts
appropriately complex for grade 1.

352FB498CE3B49BAB0D5AAD02A60209A.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

4753658025D747C4B7229A012ECF2BFA.description:
Identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on
the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

C18C9FDD6A884FB9B46507383E613537.description: Identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

42A6CF1DCF5A494F9E622810C1689D19.description: Use the illustrations and details in a text to describe its key ideas.

834DE7062B8E4A77BA2D3B210A085038.description:
Distinguish between information provided by pictures or other
illustrations and information provided by the words in a text.

6984834ADAE54531B3ACB58306F06F27.description:
Know and use various text features (e.g., headings, tables of
contents, glossaries, electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts or
information in a text.

D8C2124CD8C44DE1B14C78BA2E22448E.description:
Ask and answer questions to help determine or clarify the
meaning of words and phrases in a text.

7932965066C24594ABB8A75B3EC1E606.description:
Describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas,
or pieces of information in a text.

700288E7B7EA4F99842FC5E6758C225F.description: Identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

0213588DA27C4B64B69B15BC3404BBC6.description: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

D6621883E0554A1080DD752231735E5E.description:
With prompting and support, read prose and poetry of
appropriate complexity for grade 1.

9893F8826DA94CDB9B4A1B70D669DF39.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

86742B516ADB4FE199103C98CD91461E.description:
Compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of
characters in stories.

3F11D6632CD2438BA1235548B83631F8.description:
Use illustrations and details in a story to describe its characters,
setting, or events.

83E3F53598AA4D8284E82CDD52588AB8.description: Identify who is telling the story at various points in a text.

6F91A786EDB140759621549573D0D57F.description:
Explain major differences between books that tell stories and
books that give information, drawing on a wide reading of a range of text
types.

444BA65B54C045E183E98BDC8714FBA8.description:
Identify words and phrases in stories or poems that suggest
feelings or appeal to the senses.

1B11DC183C64458381ECC07D42E6F5A4.description:
Describe characters, settings, and major events in a story, using
key details.

4F09D2127D1B4054ACA0BEF575831955.description:
Retell stories, including key details, and demonstrate
understanding of their central message or lesson.

F54A7FB557B74E24BA506BB057F1164D.description: Ask and answer questions about key details in a text.
